result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L Dejesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF1163.

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF1163

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No association with gang members.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, DOC to follow-up on mental health concerns and psych eval if necessary. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Samuel L Dejesus in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  
State recommends that bond be modified to a cash bond. 
Defense objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond previously set shall remain.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance at 10-16-2015 01:30 pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samuel L Dejesus in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defendant would like to obtain counsel. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
